text: Neilia Hunter Biden (July 28, 1942 â€“ December 18, 1972) was an American teacher. She was the first wife of President Joe Biden. She died in a car crash in 1972 with her infant daughter, Naomi. Her two sons, Beau and Hunter, were badly injured but survived. A park in a suburban area of unincorporated New Castle County, Delaware, outside the city of Wilmington, Neilia Hunter Biden Park, is dedicated in her memory. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:1972 deaths Category:Road accident deaths in the United States Category:Educators from New York (state) Category:Joe Biden Category:People from Wilmington, Delaware Category:Educators from Wilmington, Delaware
title: Neilia Hunter Biden
